Hello,

I am writing some tests which will test our batch load processes.
T=
hese processes basically load files through our middleware and verify
the o=
utput in Oracle.

My question is related to best practices. In my current s=
ituation, I
want to write two tests:
1) is a standard operation test where =
it loads a file and makes sure
everything was sent properly to Oracle.
2) i=
s a specialized test where it loads a file and checks to see if
the site co=
de was capitalized in Oracle.

So my question is this, should I use individ=
ual files for each test
(i.e., one file containing many lines of site data =
for the first test
and then a seperate file containing a single line with a=
 lowercase
site code) and load each file at the start of each test, or shou=
ld I
combine the data from both into a single file and load that before all=

the tests are run (using a @BeforeClass)?

Thank you in advance.
